title: The Neighbour — Part Three
body:
READ PART ONE & TWO FIRST

Abstract: You decide to host a little girls night party with lots and lots of wine. By three in the morning you’re drunk enough to be able to joke about the small crush you have on Steve with your best friend, Wanda. Continuing to entertain the both of you, you write a mock text to him in your drunken state not intending to ever send it to him.

Pairing: Neighbour!Steve Rogers x reader

Word Count: 1,012 words

Warnings: fluff, alluding to smut

A/N: THINGS ARE MOVING FAST AND GETTING HEATED (but is it always a good thing ooooo??) 

Your eyes lit up as a smile stretch along your face, “Steve!” You nearly shrieked turning around and looking up at him. “How did you know?” You asked as he just shrugged, draping his arm over your shoulders, “I had a hunch,” Steve said cooly as you walked into the carnival. 

You felt a kid again, wanting to play all the games, go on all the rides, and eat all of the deep fried and sugary food. It had been years since you’d been back at the carnival, it was a family tradition of yours and you had always begged your ex to go. But he said it was too crowded, expensive, and childish. 

“Where do you wanna start?” Steve asked with a sweet smile as you both stopped at the side of the main path. You furrowed your eyes, Steve’s heart swelling at your concentration. 

“How about?” You thought aloud as your eyes scanned the crowd. “Ring toss,” you finally decided as Steve chuckled, but took your hand as you led the way. You finally got up to the booth with the ring toss, joining the small line. 

You were finally able to take Steve in. He was wearing a simple pair of jeans, white shirt, and that tan leather jacket you adored so much. He looked so innocent in the soft lights of the distant ferris wheel. 

Steve caught your stares, craning his head down to look at you. “Whachya lookin’ at?” He smirked, his Brooklyn accent coming out as you chuckled. “Just a pretty good looking dude.” You joked back and you’d never think you’d see Steve blush until now. 

“We, uh, should move up,” Steve said as he cleared his throat, voice cracking slightly as you just tried your best to bite back a smile. You were next in line, Steve handing the man working the booth four tickets. 

“Let’s see what you’ve got, doll.” Steve teased, handing you the rings. “Oh it’s on, Rogers.” You smirked back, tossing your rings. You managed to land four out of the six, Steve clapping for you. 

“Very impressive, I must say,” Steve winked. “I’ll tell you what, Rogers. If you can get all the rings, I’ll buy us cotton candy.” You wagered as Steve raised an eyebrow. 

“You know I’ve got a big sweet tooth,” Steve shrugged, “you’re on.” He was concentrating, hard. His eyebrows furrowing as you admired him from the sidelines. You bit your lip, eyes tracing his arms and torso, wondering what they’d look like without the jacket. Or anything. 

You had to force yourself to stop thinking about him that way, it was just the first date. But Steve was something special and even you knew that. Steve’s cheers snapped you out of your thoughts as you saw all rings around the bottle necks. 

The man at the stand lowered a medium sized stuffed bear, handing it to Steve as he walked over to you. “I believe you owe me some cotton candy.” He winked as you held back a smile. “I do play by the rules.” You hummed, “is that for me?” You teased as Steve feigned not knowing what you were talking about. 

“Oh you mean this!” He chuckled, “I was thinkin’ of addin’ him to my stuffed animal collection.” He teased and you couldn’t help but laugh. “But I guess I could spare him for you, doll,” he winked, handing the bear over to you. 

You couldn’t help but blush, feeling him wrap his arm around your shoulders, tightening them as he pressed a kiss to the top of your head. Your heart fluttered and your stomach jumped, unable to hide the smile on your face. 

You had to stop walking, bending over as you continued laughing from Steve’s stories about his best friend, Bucky. Someone who you’d met before in the halls, but not enough to call him a friend. 

“I can’t wait to meet him.” You said as you calmed down, resuming the walk down the hall. “He’ll love you.” Steve’s smile was beaming as he looked down at you. 

You finally arrived at your door, “well, this is me.” You chuckled as Steve stuffed his hands in his pocket. “I had a really great time,” he said, looking at you. You nodded your head, “me too, Steve. Thank you for dragging me out on a date with you.” You joked, making him laugh. 

“You think I earned a second date?” Steve asked, voice a little unsteady and nervous. “I think you earned a third date, Steve.” You almost whispered as you both stood still. 

You wanted to kiss him so bad, eyes flicking up to his lips. You felt him take a half a step closer, leaning in slightly. “Forgive me if I’m out of line,” Steve whispered, “but I really wanna kiss you.” 

His fingers brushed a strand of hair behind your ear. “Kiss me,” you said, barely above a whisper. Steve smiled, slowly closing the gap between the two of you in a soft and sweet kiss that made you feel as if you were floating. 

He pulled away, your eyes fluttering open at the lack of contact. “Goodnight, [Y/N].” Steve whispered, placing one last kiss right above your jaw before walking back to his own apartment. You were left alone with the biggest smile on your face and the taste of candy and peppermint on your lips. 

When you finally walked into your apartment you set all your stuff down on the closest surface before staring at your front door. You don’t know what overcame you, but next thing you knew, you were knocking at Steve’s front door. 

He opened it quickly, still in the same shirt he wore, but now in a pair of sweatpants. You wrapped your arms around his neck, pressing your lips to his as you felt him wrap his arms around your waist, pressing his lips harder against yours. 

“God, I was hopin’ you’d do that,” he groaned against your lips, before lifting you as you wrapped your legs around his waist.

“Where do you wanna start?” Steve asked with a sweet smile as you both stopped at the side of the main path. You furrowed your eyes, Steve’s heart swelling at your concentration.

title: False Thoughts (A Request)
body:
Requested: Anonymous

Word Count: 784

Pairing: Chris Evans X Reader

Warnings: None

Request: Hey Rose, I recently Chris Evans False Rumor imagine. Just wanted to say I enjoyed it and the positive age gap thing. I was thinking if could you do a prequel to False Rumors. Where Chris Evans tells her how he feels. If not understand. Thank you, have nice day.

A/n: This is a prequel to my work ‘False Rumors’ thank you for sending this request in!

Masterlist

You stood off to the side of the set, waiting for the call to scene.

Shifting your weight back and forth on your feet, you felt a smile on your lips as you heard laughter between Tom and Anthony. Their shenanigans getting in the way of filming, not that anyone was particularly mad at that.

Feeling a presence behind you, you turned to see Chris Evans.

“Chris!” You squealed, your smile bursting forth full force as you jumped to hug the Captain America Actor.

You caught your breath and once you let go of Chris you looked up, admiring his mustache that he grew out for his new role in Lobby Hero.

Slapping his chest lightly, you scolded, “You didn’t respond to my text last night about drinks.” You took a moment to think, then continued, “Actually, why are you here? You already filmed your last scene.”

You watched in wonder as a pink blush flushed his cheeks.

Butterflies fluttered in your stomach and your mouth went dry as you drank up the sight of the older man.

You had a major crush on him. Despite the age difference. So you never acted on your urge to ask him out, always keeping it casual, friendly. There was no way in your mind that this older, handsome, decorated actor would want to date a young actress like yourself.

“Umm…well…I saw the news last night and..”

You laughed, the sound awkward, as you waved a hand, “Yeah I know. Those reporters are getting dumber by the day I swear. Just because Tom and I were spotted walking side by side in the afternoon, suddenly we’re dating.”

Chris’s baby blue eyes widened for a second before becoming steely with determination. Drawing a breath, “So you two aren’t? You know? A thing?”

You squinted at Chris. His voice was timid. Which was unlike his normal, joking, boisterous self.

“No.” Your tone broke no room for argument. It had been disgusting when you saw the report the night before about you and Tom secretly dating. He was a good friend and those reporters were twisting it to fit their narrative.

Chris let out a sigh, of relief. Which confused you.

Then he smiled. And it was so bright, you swore you would become blind.

“Good. That’s..that’s good.”

You laid a hand on his arm, watching as his eyes flitted to your hand before back to your gaze, “Chris. You’re worrying me. Why did you come to set today? I know it wasn’t just about the report last night. We deal with nosey reporters all the time. I am a big girl, you know.” You teased with a smirk and a wink.

You could only watch with fascination as Chris swallowed hard, his adam’s apple bobbing.

“Ahhh. Yes, Well…I wanted to see if you…Well…if you wanted to come see the opening night of Lobby Hero.”

You smiled softly at him. Was that what he was worried about? That you wouldn’t be happy about his success outside of the MCU universe?

“Of course. I’m sure the rest of the cast would love to come to. Let me ask-”

You were cut off and your hand grabbed by his as you turned to ask the others. Turning back with a questioning look, you saw Chris’s jaw tick as he fought to get the words out.

“No..like as a date. I’m asking if you want to …go out…with me?” He winced, as if expecting a slap or something.

Meanwhile, you had stopped working. The Exe. Error symbol running through your head. No thoughts coming to you.

Your mouth open in shock. Eyes staring at Chris.

And then it was like reality slammed back into you.

Your lips widened in a wide smile as you giggled, “Really?”

He smiled softly down at you, “Really Really.”

That had you cracking up, “Did you just quote Shrek!?”

Your raised voice finally caught the attention of the others on set as Tom bounced over with a shit eating grin, “Did someone say Shrek?”

Chris sighed lowly. But you merely winked at him, before moving closer and lowering your voice, “I would love to go out with you. Pick me up at Eight.”

The grin that took over Chris’s face could rival the sun with its brightness. And you could no longer deny the thumping of your heart as you took in his face.

This man. This amazing, incredible man, wanted to go out with you. Didn’t care about the age gap like you thought he would.

And as he began joking with Tom, and saying hello to Anthony, you couldn’t help but hope that maybe this relationship could last.

title: 600 Celebration: A Good One
body:
Summary: Steve enjoys a day at the park with his family.

Somehow 600 of you decided my weirdness is fun to follow so I’m writing a series with six installments to commemorate this milestone, cuz why not? Thank you for following and being part of this community with me. I really do enjoy being on here and being insane with each and every one of you. This is the fourth installment of the series!

Word Count: 527 (a little shorter than usual… this cold/flu thing is really kicking me in the butt)

Warnings: None! Just some good, old fashion fluff. 

A/N: Really trying out some writing and stuff. Feedback is always appreciated. Taking a slight detour from all things Sebastian/Bucky and throwing in some love for Chris Evans/Steve Rogers.

It’s spring in New York; there’s a crispness in the air, left over from winter that combats the slowly rising temperatures. Flowers are blooming and people are in good moods.

Steve sits on a park bench, sunglasses and baseball cap hiding his face, just watching people enjoy themselves. It brings him a deep sense of satisfaction. This is what he fought for: peace and joy.

It’s a calm afternoon by weekend standards. Steve is not used to so much quiet. That was all he wanted after the war; no more bombs or bullets or the smell of smoke. Just complete quiet. But sitting in the sunlight with nothing but his thoughts, Steve feels something is missing. There’s a strange sense of longing, for companionship and cuddles.

The former soldier doesn’t stew in his somberness for long. A pair of tiny arms manages to catch him off guard, wrapping around his neck from behind.

“Daddy, whatcha doin’?”

It’s the voice of perfection, of tiny hair ribbons and purple knee-length dresses. It calls to him in the middle of the night, sometimes in the whines of a residual nightmare, other times in request for “just one more story.”

It’s his own personal reminder that the sacrifice was worth it.

“Just talkin’ to the birds,” he responds, with a smile and a tug. His lap is her favorite seat.

“What’re they saying?”

“Well that black one over there, he was telling his buddy, the grey one, that there’s this real mean cat that lives on his block. He’s scared the cat is trying to eat his kids.”

“Oh no!” his daughter reacts in genuine distress. “Daddy, you need to help him!”

Steve chuckles at her compassion.

“I think I better stay out of this one, let the birds figure it out for themselves. The cat hasn’t won any battles yet, so I think they’re doing alright for themselves.”

Steve wonders where the time has gone, mind flashing back to days when she could barely walk, barely speak, barely understand the world. Now here she was, so smart and kind and caring – all things she got from his better half.

“Who wants ice cream?” 

It’s the voice of heaven, of comfort and warmth. 

“Me! Me! Me!”

Steve turns his head to be greeted by three fudge popsicles. From there, it’s a mess of dripping stickiness, a mountain of tissues and a litany of “be careful”s. The bench dips as you take a seat next to father and daughter. Three mouths become framed and crusted with chocolate rings outlining happy smiles.

Once everyone is finished, your daughter takes off again, to yet another new adventure. She murmurs something about saving a family of pigeons, to which you respond with furrowed brows directed at your husband.

All he does is lift his shoulders, cracking another smile before turning his head to watch her run off.

“We got a good one; let’s hope the next is just as easy,” he says, resting a hand on your growing bump.

summary: can you do 9, 14, and 17 with chris evans?? like where he wants to finally propose so he's surprising reader and reader's never...
question: can you do 9, 14, and 17 with chris evans?? like where he wants to finally propose so he's surprising reader and reader's never seen snow and obviously has no idea what he's doing
answer:
9. “Let’s go.” 14. “Oh, it is on.” 17. “It’s snowing.” 

A/N: Hello thank you for requesting, I hope you like this and also beware of major fluff! Let me know what you think! Thank you ♡ I’m so sorry this took so long! 

Also, send in a request using this Prompt List!! Send in the asks here!!

Y/N’s hand sat comfortably in the crook of Chris’s arm. They were walking through the beautiful scenes of Boston during its final changes if fall to winter. It was a chilly night, where the sudden breeze would pinch at the couples cheeks and noses. Leaving bright red trail marks in its wake.

Y/N smiled up at Chris, feeling like there was something wrong with him. He had been distant from the moment he had been picked her up from her place. “Chris?” She called out. “Is everything okay?”

He nodded his head at Y/N, “it’s a chilly tonight, huh?” He was trying to change the subject, something that he did often to avoid something Y/N asked or said.

“Chris, what’s going on? Is something wrong?”

“Nothing, sweetheart, I promise. Let’s go,” Chris reached his opposite hand over and gave Y/N a reassuring squeeze.

Y/N sighed, there was something on his mind but she knew better than to push the topic. So, she brushed it off turning her attention to the beautiful scenery that stood before them. It was silent for a long moment until Chris cleared his throat and asked, “would you like me to take a picture of you?”

“Sure,” shrugged, fixing herself before looking onto the scenery. Allowing Chris to take a not so candid picture of the moment. It was a while since she heard anything coming from Chris. Not a click of a camera nor comment from him so she partially turned, confused as to what was going on.

“Did you get it?”

When she got no response, she turned and in then her heart dropped. There was Chris kneeling down on one knee, with a velvet jewellery box in his hand. Y/N’s gloved hand rose to her mouth, her eyes tearing up; to which she was sure because Chris was doing and not because of the stinging chill. “Oh my god.”

“Y/N, I have thought of this moment ever since I met you because I knew that you were the one for me. You were the one that I had been waiting for, so will you marry me?”

By then, Y/N had tears rolling down her cheeks as she nodded her head. “yes!” Chris pulled the ring from its place and slid it carefully onto Y/N’s finger. He stood up and pulled her into a kiss and a hug. Once they separated, Chris looked down and asked,

“Do you like it?”

Y/N’s jaw dropped at Chris’ question, of course, she liked it. Truthfully, she didn’t even need a ring. She was simply was just happy at the idea to spend the rest of her life with Chris. “I love it.”

She leaned up at to peck Chris’ lips until she felt a wet spatter fall on her nose. She pulled back with confusion until she felt a sudden more, causing her to chuckle. “What’s going on?”

Chris looked up to finally realize what was falling from the sky, making him grin to grow even wider. “It’s snowing.” It was Y/N’s first time to experience snow so, for it to be the day she got engaged was altogether magical and special.

Y/N’s eyes grew wide as she turned to Chris and practically squealed with excitement. “Now we can have a snow fight!”

Chris let out a bolting laugh, his hand shooting out to grab at his chest. “Oh, it is on.”

title: Cream and Sugar
body:
Steve has a thing for the local barista, but can Captain America really have a relationship?

Chapter 2

Steve held Melanie’s chair as she sat.

“What do you want?” he asked.

“Maybe I should go order. I do know how you take yours.”

He leaned over with his hands on the table. “You get my coffee almost every morning. Let me get yours this time.”

“Two creams, four sugars.”

“Four? You like it sweet.”

“I do. Decaf, please.”

Steve ordered their coffees then returned to their table to wait.

“So… decaf.”

“It’s too late for caffeine. I’d be up late, have to get up early for work. Not fun.”

“I guess I forget. Caffeine doesn’t affect me now. Alcohol, either.”

“Well, we know who the designated driver is.”

Steve smiled. “Does that imply future dates?”

“We’ll have to see.”

The barista sat their coffees in front of them, and Melanie watched her gaze linger over Steve until she walked away. A quick glance around the room found others doing the same. If Steve noticed he didn’t pay any attention to it.

“So, what do you do for fun, other than draw?”

Steve took a sip of the coffee. The steam coming from it was proof that it was way too hot, and would have burned the mouth of anyone else.

“I don’t have much free time,” he said. “I’m either training or learning.”

“What are you learning?”

“The world. I lost a lot of years.”

Melanie shook her head. “Right. Sorry, I didn’t even think about that.”

“It’s ok. I like that you didn’t think about that.”

Melanie smiled. “Ok, if you had the free time, what would you want to do for fun?”

Steve sat back in his chair and took a deep breath. “I don’t know. What do you do for fun?”

Melanie chuckled. “Most of my fun is solo activities. I read a lot. Movies, tv. Nothing as far as talent goes, like your drawing.”

“Sounds like you and I are passing time the same way. Maybe we could do it together, sometime?”

Melanie’s eyes widened and Steve blushed.

“Pass time, I mean.”

She laughed, and nodded. “Yeah, that could be fun. I’ll bet there’s movies I love that you haven’t seen yet.”

“That’s a safe bet. I think—”

“Excuse me,” a blonde walked over and sat on the edge of your table, leaning in front of you to face Steve. “You’re Captain America aren’t you?”

Steve sighed. “Yes, ma'am.”

“I think what you do is so amazing.”

“Thank you, but we’ve got men and women who do more than I do everyday—”

“Sure, but are they as sexy as you?”

“Ma'am, I’m having coffee with someone, if you don’t mind.”

She flipped her hair. “I don’t mind. So, are you—”

Melanie stood and walked around the blonde intruder as she continued talking. She took Steve’s hand, tugged him to his feet, and led him from the coffee shop.

“Hey, I was talking to him!”

“That’s right, you were.”

Outside, Steve took a deep breath. “Thank you.”

“Bet you’re not used to forward women.”

“Not really. I mean, we had some forward women in my day, but they tried to hide it. Way more subtle. Not so rude.”

“Welcome to the new millennium.”

Melanie glanced at her watched and Steve shoved his hands into his pockets.

“Somewhere to be?”

“It’s early. How would you like to come back to my apartment and watch one of those movies?”

Steve’s eyebrow twitched.

“Purest of intentions,” she said, “I promise.” She crossed her heart. “I just figured you could have some privacy.”

“That sounds great, actually.”

At her apartment, Melanie scanned over her DVD’s looking for something she thought Steve might enjoy. It wasn’t until her eyes landed on a box set of a tv show that she smiled.

“Have you ever watched I Love Lucy?”

“No. Heard of it, though.”

Melanie pulled out the first disc and popped it into the player.

“It was a tv show in the 50’s. A little closer to the type of entertainment you would have been used to.”

She sat next to him on the sofa, leaving just enough space so that they weren’t touching, and grabbed the remote.

“I thought the point of this was to get me caught up on modern stuff?”

“I thought the point was to enjoy ourselves?”

Steve smiled.

“This is a date, right?” Melanie asked.

“Right. A date.”

The smile slowly faded from Steve’s lips as his eyes flicked over Melanie’s face. Melanie cleared her throat and started the first episode.

“So, what we have here is a situation comedy. Every week, Lucy finds herself in a new situation, and misunderstandings and slapstick comedy ensue.”

“Sounds kind of predictable.”

“In general, yes, but the brilliance is in the ridiculousness.”

After laughing his way through the first episode, Steve asked to continue. Two more in and Steve’s arm ended up behind Melanie on the back of the couch. His presence was overpowering.

“Would you like something to drink?” she asked.

“No thanks.”

Steve settled into the couch a little more, his leg drifting until it rested against Melanie’s. She sighed, louder than she meant to.

“You ok?”

“Fine. Why?”

Steve grabbed the remote and paused the show.

“You seem a little… uncomfortable.”

“I’m not uncomfortable.”

He sat up a little straighter. “Have I worn out my welcome?”

“Absolutely not.”

“Well, something’s changed.”

“I’m fine.”

She played with her fingers in her lap until Steve took one of her hands in his.

“Talk to me.”

“Ok. Honesty.”

“That would be nice.”

He visibly tensed, as if waiting for some horrible confession.

“You coming into the coffee shop was a huge surprise. I knew who you were the moment I saw you, but you had that hat and you were kind of hunched, like you were trying to hide. So, I didn’t say anything.”

“It’s what made me come back.”

Melanie nodded. “I kind of figured. But, I’m human. I was attracted to you before you walked in. News and photos… that suit does amazing things for you.”

Steve blushed, but Melanie kept going.

“Having you here, next to me, I’m just finding it a little difficult to not focus on how attractive you are.”

“Well, that’s quite a confession.”

Steve smiled as he said her words back to her. She smiled back.

“Yeah. And after the way that woman hit on you at the coffee house, I didn’t want you to think I was pulling the same thing.”

She stared at their joined hands. His thumb swept back and forth over her skin. When she looked up, Steve put his free hand to her face and pressed his lips to hers. An almost chaste kiss, except for the hum he released. He sighed as he pulled away.

“You free tomorrow?”

“Two nights in a row? I thought you didn’t have that much free time?”

“I’ll make time. Tomorrow?”

“Tomorrow. More Lucy?”

Steve smiled. “Sure. Maybe I can bring dinner?”

“Now, that is a great idea.”

Steve chuckled. He stood and walked to the door, never letting go of her hand. His free hand tucked a stray piece of hair behind her ear, then he pressed his lips to hers, very briefly.

“Good night.”

“Good night, Steve.”

body:
Here we go

Okay guys

So recently I haven’t been motivated to continue the series that I have been working on so to get me back into the groove of things

REQUESTS ARE OPEN FOR 24 HOURS


RULES:

To submit a request you have to drop an ask. Comments will not be accepted

Must be a one shot or short imagine request

Will also accept head cannons



WHO I AM ACCEPTING FOR

Marvel - characters or actors (primarily Evans, Stan, Hiddleston)

Henry Cavill

August Walker (mission impossible)

I WILL ALSO ACCEPT AU’S BECAUSE I THINK THEY ARE REALLY FUNN


24 HOURS!!!


Let the requests begin

summary:
sebastian stan shares his favorite memories with chris evans on set 
MCMcon London (25/05/2019)
the first part has been cut off...
body:
sebastian stan shares his favorite memories with chris evans on set

MCMcon London (25/05/2019)

the first part has been cut off here but here’s the full transcript :

fan : what’s your favorite memory with chris evans on set?

seb : what’s my favorite memory with chris evans on set?? at first I thought you said “sunset” !! (lol)

fan : that too! 🤷🏻‍♀️😂

seb : maybe there was a moment with chris evans on sunset. (again, lol) …no, uhh, I think we laughed a lot…you know here’s the thing about being back in London, and this is why it’s so.. sometimes like.. I was walking around yesterday and y’know we shot the first Captain America here. The First Avenger —we shot in London. and y’know I was walking around and I remembered all the places that I used to film, and sort of like, get food at and so on and I think- he and I had a really great time at that- during that movie because I remember that was the first time we connected, and the first time we were kind of explored the friendship and the characters, and we would hang out a lot in London. So maybe- maybe any of those moments. He’s very funny, very funny.”
